intro: Stylidium pseudocaespitosum, commonly known as the clustered triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant has a short, erect stem with dense clusters of leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, spurred flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and wasps. Stylidium pseudocaespitosum is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions.
